intro: Ceropegia mariae, commonly known as the Marie's moonvine, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and tubular flowers. The plant produces small, fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture. Ceropegia mariae is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soil with bright, indirect light.
